Jquery-input-navigation

Retro-like navigation trough input fields using arrow keys.

  • Download ZIP
  • Download TAR
  • View On GitHub

Project maintained by a group of devs in the caribbean

What? arrow keys?

We thought it would be fun to build a simple jQuery plugin for navigatino between textboxes.

Check out the example below, and just press up/down to navigate between the elements.











How to use

Add a reference to the library:

<script src="scripts/jquery-input-navigation.js"></script>

Then, either mark a container with the data-input-navigation attribute:

<form data-input-navigation>
    <input type="text" value="Textbox 1">
    <input type="text" value="Textbox 2">
    <input type="text" value="Textbox 3">
    <!-- Any additional elements -->
</form>

Or you can perform binding manually on the $(document).ready() jQuery event:

$(function(){
    $('#container-id').inputNavigation(options);    
});

Options

The plugin supports some configuration, passed to the constructor event, or as a well-formed json string on the container tag property:

{
    cyclic: false,
    inputs: ':text',
    keybindings: {
        next: 40,
        prev: 38
    }
}

cyclic

Indicates wether the array should behave in a cyclic-fashion. That is, if after getting to the last element, executing the 'next' position brings the cursor back to the first one.

inputs

Defines the element types to be scanned by the plugin upon automatic instantiation. This is a feature that hasn't been implemented yet, but we're working on it ;)

keybindings

Defines which keys are bound to which action. Expect more actions to be defined soon for two-axis navigation.
